item.title: Setting up Hugo
item.author: Karl
item.description:
Setting up Hugo

After 8 months, I am back posting on my website. Hopefully more will follow. I will be updating this post over the coming days to document my current setup for this website. I am using hugo install with homebrew on a mac.

item.title: Why Hugo
item.author: Karl
item.description: Starting a Blog After not blogging for many years, I wanted to write again. The purpose is to help collect my thoughts and record the technical skills I am learning. Writing about it makes it easier to remember. A blog also allows me to keep learning, whether it is technical or photography skills. I wanted something easy to use at first. I could always switch to something else later. Now, I have been writing with Markdown for years.

item.title: Starting the 3D Printer Journey
item.author: Karl
item.description: Starting the 3D Printer Journey Printer Head The two things that really inspire me are exploring and creating. Exploring can be traveling or doing something new, trying something out. Creating is about making something new. For me, this usually means either modifying something that already exists (improving) or building together something with exciting pieces. As a kid, I loved legos, and legos are how I think about creating. Legos pieces can be code, computer chips, or kitchen cabinets.

item.title: First Post
item.author: Karl
item.description: Welcome I am restarting my blog with two goals. The first one is to give me a digital presence in which to communicate to the digital world. The second is to help keep track of my goals somewhere. I have been writing to markdown files privately, but I wanted to start doing this publicly since most of the information might be helpful to others and not need to be kept secure.
